author: gcolvin
content: A quick idea - one way to get more eyes on proposals would be to implement a more formal peer-review process.  That is, the author and editors work to find appropriate reviewers for particular PRs.  That spreads the load to more volunteers and helps ensure that appropriate experts take a look.

author: sky.cactus
content: I like anything that gets more people looking at EIPs and (hopefully) getting them improved more before I see them.

author: sky.cactus
content: In a world of fairies and ponies, by the time I (an editor) look at an EIP it is already pretty high quality and I just have to give it a quick once-over.

<@!683653554631868440> I briefly mentioned about this idea in the meeting today. I'd be happy to help with this process.
